baby_step_column_fields.text: Find an issue to work on.

receive_feedback.metric: Received critical feedback on a PR/issue which was then followed up with a resubmission that was eventually accepted.

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video will explain how you can maximize your chances of receiving feedback on your PR.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you receive (and act on) one point of critical feedback on this issue?
Write a 1 sentence summary of the feedback you received and the action you took to address it.
Did you solve the issue within 3 months?

blog_post.quality: Understanding the impact of the work

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the blog post:

edge_cases.metric: 1 PR with a detailed breakdown of edge cases considered.

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video will demonstrate an example of how to document edge cases in a PR.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you write a detailed breakdown of edges cases in the pull request description?

high_quality_question.metric: 1 example of a high-quality question asked on the Github thread

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video will demonstrate an example of a high-quality question.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github comment where you asked a high-quality question:

propose_implementation_plan.metric: 1 example of a proposal where you seek feedback on how you plan to solve the issue

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video will provide some tips on how to develop a plan including how to leverage AI.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github comment where you proposed your implementation plan:

above_and_beyond.metric: Solution goes beyond the acceptance criteria for the issue.

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video provides a few examples of what it means to go 'above and beyond' on an issue.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 1 sentence explanation of how your solution went beyond the acceptance criteria for the issue.

give_feedback.metric: Leave a comment on a PR/issue that is not your own.

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video shows an example of how you might leave a helpful comment on someone else's issue.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github issue or PR where you left a comment:

find_bug.metric: Find and file a new bug.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the new issue you created:

complex_bug.metric: Solve a complex bug, explore multiple branches, get to the root cause.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to a blog post, video, or detailed pull request description where you explain the solution:

initiative.metric: Submit a proposal for solving a problem for the project that wasn't directly asked for.

baby_step_column_fields.text: This helper video demonstrates how you can initiate a proposal that serves the project's users.
This helper video demonstrates how you can initiate a proposal that serves developers on the project.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the new issue you created where you described your proposal:

use_product.metric: Self-host the product and use it in a meaningful way or use the product/library in a personal project.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to a video walkthrough demonstrating how you used the product:

advocate.metric: 1 example of back-and-forth conversation where you advocate for your perspective while also demonstrating flexibility.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 1 sentence summary of the conversation you had and the outcome.

seek_feedback.metric: Feedback was proactively sought either from maintainers or users

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video demonstrates an example of how to proactivelyseek feedback on a PR.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the github comment where you sought feedback:
Write a 1 sentence summary of the feedback you received and how you incorporated it into your work.

thorough_documentation.metric: 1 example of a PR with thorough documentation explaining the contribution.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you include a thorough explanation of the contribution in the pull request description?

thorough_documentation.notes: TODO: Add an optional checkbox to ask whether they left comments throughout the timeline of the PR.

AI_usage.quality: Apply AI to solve every day problems
AI_usage.metric: 1 example of using AI APIs to simplify or automate personal or business workflows

proof_of_completion.text: Link to a personal project or blog post describing how you used AI to simplify or automate a workflow:
Write a 1 sentence summary of how you used AI to simplify or automate a workflow.

case_study.metric: Blog post exploring a specfic aspect of the project

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the blog post:

outside_comfort_zone.metric: 1 example of a large/complex issue where you pick a task outside of your comfort zone.

baby_step_column_fields.text: The helper video shows an example of what it means to document progress on a long-running PR.

proof_of_completion.text: Did you write comments throughout the timeline of the PR?
Write a 1 sentence explanation of one new thing you had to learn to solve the issue:
Link to a short (<750 words) blog post where you describe the solution:

live_coding.metric: Host a live coding session where you solve an issue from start to finish OR team-based Code Jam.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to a recording of the live coding session or a link to a short blog post describing the Code Jam

passion_project.metric: 1 example of a personal project that was useful for others or to explore your curiosity.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the personal project:
Write a 1 sentence summary of the project and how it was useful for others or how it helped you to explore your curiosity.

puzzle_hobby.metric: 1 example of a puzzle or hobby that you are passionate about.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 1 sentence summary of the hobby.
Link to a short blog post where you describe the hobby.  There should be some evidence of a long-term dedication to the hobby.

integration_focused_PR.metric: 1 example of a PR that bridges two disconnected systems or abstractions.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 1 sentence summary of the PR and how it bridges two disconnected systems or abstractions.

SWE_pipeline_blog_post.metric: 1 concise (< 750 words) technical blog post about the SWE pipeline of an open source project.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the blog post:

SWE_pipeline_personal_project.metric: 1 example of setting up the SWE workflow (linter, CI/CD, etc.) for a personal project.

proof_of_completion.text: Link a detailed README.md for the personal project documenting the SWE workflow

product_opinion.metric: Short blog post stating your opinion on what new features should be added to the product.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the blog post:

understand_purpose.metric: Short blog post describing the purpose of the product, how it is used, and comparison to alternatives.

proof_of_completion.text: Link to the blog post:

multiple_approaches.metric: 1 example of considering multiple approaches to solve an issue.

proof_of_completion.text: Write a 2-3 sentence summary of the multiple approaches you considered and why you chose the one you did.
